article.headline: Lafayette 91, Columbia 74
article.story: EASTON, Pa. -- Ryan Willen scored 27 points, including 16 in the second half, as Lafayette pulled away from Columbia to win 91-74 on Wednesday night. Willen's layup and 3-pointer started a 10-0 second-half run by the Leopards (9-6) that put them ahead 62-53 with 11:47 remaining. The Lafayette spurt came just after the Lions (6-7) had taken their only lead since the game's opening 1:10. Lafayette, which shot 60.4 percent (29-for-48) for the game, took a double-digit lead, 68-57, on Jeff Kari's layup with 9:23 left and never led by less than 11 the rest of the way. The Leopards enjoyed a huge advantage at the free throw line, making 24 of 31, while Columbia was 9-for-16. Jim Mower added 15 points, Jared Mintz 12 and Tony Johnson 11 for Lafayette. Noruwa scored 26 points to lead Columbia, which also got 14 from Nico Scott and 13 from Asenso Ampim.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
